Price Action > Headlines

AMD surges 37% Pre-Market After Multi-Billion Chip Deal with OpenAI

OpenAI and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) have signed a multibillion-dollar agreement that could give OpenAI up to a 10% ownership stake in AMD.

Key details:

- OpenAI will deploy 6 gigawatts of AMD Instinct GPUs over multiple years, starting with 1 GW in the second half of 2026.

- AMD has issued warrants for up to 160 million shares to OpenAI, vesting based on deployment milestones and AMD‚Äôs share price performance.

- If fully exercised, the warrants would give OpenAI approximately 10% ownership in AMD.

- The deal is expected to generate tens of billions of dollars in revenue for AMD over the next five years.
OpenAI valued the agreement at billions of dollars, but did not disclose the exact figure.

- Following the announcement, AMD stock surged more than 37% in premarket trading on October 06, 2025, marking one of its strongest gains in recent years. 

- The agreement positions AMD as a major player in the AI chip market and helps OpenAI diversify its supply chain beyond a single vendor.

The aviation sector currently shows strong metrics: 3.6% annual passenger growth, demand for 43,000+ new aircraft by 2044. Yet investor sentiment remains cautious on eVTOL plays. This disconnect creates the opportunity $FMKT is exploiting with our Archer position. (9/10)

Deutsche Bank raised its gold price forecast by $300 for 2026 to an average of $4,000 per ounce, citing strong central bank demand, potential US dollar weakness and a resumption of a Fed rate-easing cycle.
